page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object to property array function
page.description: Convert the ResultSet to a property array.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ToPropertyArray(Array as p[] [, RowsToCopy = -1 as N [, StartRow = -1 as N ]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: SQL::ResultSet
argument.description: A SQL::ResultSet object created with a DIM statement.

argument.name: RowsToCopy
argument.description: Optional. Default = -1. The number of rows to copy.

argument.name: StartRow
argument.description: Optional. Default = 1. The first row to copy.

page.discussion: The ToPropertyArray() method creates pointer elements named after the names of the table field. It replaces spaces in names with underscores.
page.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim connString as C dim select_exp as C dim arr[0] as P connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" select_exp = "select * from customer where bill_state_region = 'ny'" if .not. conn.open(connString) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if if .not. conn.execute(select_exp) ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) conn.close() end end if rs = conn.ResultSet rs.ToPropertyArray(arr) conn.close() ui_msg_box("Results", arr.dump_properties("Firstname Lastname, Bill_State_Region"))
